Dispute_Type: Genuine marriage vs. sham marriage for immigration purposes
Legal_Issue: Whether the marriage between Margaret Owusu and Frank Acheampong was genuine or entered into primarily to obtain immigration status
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, Section 4
Outcome: Original decision quashed; case remanded for new hearing
Credibility_Assessment: IAD found inconsistencies in knowledge between spouses; court found assessment patently unreasonable
Evidence_Type: Testimonial evidence regarding marital relationship, communication patterns, cultural context
Legal_Provision: Section 4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Basis_of_Claim: Marriage was not genuine and was entered into for immigration advantage
Evaluation_Standard: Genuineness of marriage under immigration regulations
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inconsistencies in spousal knowledge, cultural differences, financial considerations, limited communication
Proceeding_Type: Sponsorship appeal before IAD, followed by judicial review
Regulation_Cited: Section 4, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Application_Error: Failure to consider cultural differences and contextual factors in assessing marriage
Review_Outcome: Decision set aside due to patent unreasonableness
Evidence_Ignored: Cultural differences, financial constraints, limited communication opportunities
Application_Factor: Marriage entered into primarily for immigration benefit
Decision_Outcome: Rejection of sponsorship application by IAD
Authority: Immigration Appeal Division (IAD), Federal Court on review
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the IAD's conclusion on the marriageâ€™s genuineness was patently unreasonable
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 4, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Outcome_of_Review: Quashed and remitted to a new IAD panel
Cause_of_Refusal: Suspected sham marriage based on perceived inconsistencies
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 4, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient weight given to non-traditional marital dynamics and cultural context
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to adequately consider all relevant factors affecting credibility
Credibility_Issues: Perceived lack of shared knowledge between spouses
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Marriage was genuine despite atypical characteristics due to cultural and financial factors
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Procedural_Issue: Inadequate reasoning and consideration of contextual factors by IAD
Omission_Type: Failure to consider cultural and socioeconomic context
